list.label: Vitalis Indicatio,
list.item: is a way whereby Strength and Vigor are continually renewed and preſerved.
list.label: Vitiligo,
list.item:
a ſort of Leproſy; there are Three kinds of them. Alphus where the Colour is white, ſomething rough, and not continued, like ſo many Drops here and there; but ſometimes it ſpreads broader, and with ſome Intermiſſions. Melas differs in Colour, becauſe it is black, and like a Shade; in the reſt they agree. Leuce has
ſomething like Alphus, but it is whiter, and deſcends deeper, and in it the Hairs are white, and like Down: All theſe ſpread, but in ſome quicker, in others ſlower.
list.label: Vitreus Humor,
list.item: ſee Humores Oculi.
list.label: Ʋlceratio,
list.item: ſee Exulceratio.
list.label: Ʋlcus, an Uucer,
list.item: is a Solution of the Continuum, proceeding from a conſuming Matter, in the ſoft parts of the Body, and attended with a Diminution of Magnitude.
list.label: Ʋlna, or Focile majus,
list.item: is the greater Bone betwixt the Arm and the Wriſt, which is jointed upward with the Shoulder by Ginglimus (which ſee,) and therefore it has there both Proceſſes and Cavities: Two oblong Proceſſes, and as it were triangular, and rugged, that the Ligaments may knit it ſtrongly. The fore-moſt and upper-moſt is leſs, and goes into the Cavity of the Shoulder: The backward Proceſs is thicker and larger, ends in an obtuſe Angle, and enters the hinder Cavity of the Shoulder; the Latines call it Gibberus: In the middle of theſe there's a great Cavity like a Semicircle. It has yet another external lateral Cavity for the Head of the Radius, or leſſer Bone of the Cubit; it is joynted at the lower end with the Wriſt, both by a Cartilage in the middle, and by an acute Proceſs, and therefore called Styloides (or like a ſharp-pointed Pen uſed in Writing-Tables) whence there ariſes a Ligament, which faſtens the Cubit and the Joynt of the Wriſt together.
list.label: Ʋlomelia,
list.item: is a Soundneſs of the whole Body.
list.label: Ʋmbilicus, the Navel,
list.item: is a Boſs in the middle of the Abdomen, to which the Navel-ſtring in a Faetus is joined, which is cut off after Delivery.
list.label: Ʋncia, an Ounce,
list.item: is the Twelfth part of a Phyſicians Pound, containing eight Drams.
list.label: Ʋndimia,
list.item: the ſame that Oedema.
list.label: Ʋnguentum, an Ointment,
list.item: is a Medicine outwardly applied, of a Conſiſtence ſomething thicker than a Linimentum: It is called alſo Ʋnguen.
list.label: Ʋnguis, a Nail,
list.item:
is a ſimilar, flexible, white, and hard part, which defends the Fingers from external Injuries, and in ſome meaſure adorns them. The root of it is joined to a certain Ligament, and by reaſon of the neighbouring Tendons it becomes ſenſible: They ſeem to be made of a Collection of very little Pipes, which adhere extreamly thick to one onother, and ſhoot out into length. Where they begin, there you find certain nervous Fibres like ſo many ſmall Nipples lengthened, the lengthened parts whereof are ſeen as far as the Nail: If they be forcibly torn off, they leave divers Holes, ſo that the Horney Subſtance of the Nails looks like a Net. Under the Nails there is a pappy ſort of Body, which has its Veſſels of Excretion. The Apices, or tops of the Nails, are they which grow beyond the Fleſh; the Parts which are cut, are called the Segmina, the parings of the Nails, the parts under the Nails, are the 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , the hidden parts; the White ſemilunar part next the Root, is the Riſe of the Nail; the very beginnings that grow into the Skin, are called
the Roots of the Nails; the Sides, the Clefts; the white Spots, Nubecula, little Clouds, &c.
list.label: Ʋngula,
list.item: is a ſort of hooked Inſtrument to draw a dead Faetus out of the Womb.
list.label: Ʋngula Oculi,
list.item: the ſame that Pterygium.
list.label: Vola,
list.item: is the Palm of the Hand; alſo the Cavity of the Foot.
list.label: Volatica,
list.item: the ſame that Lichen.
list.label: Volſella, or Vulſella,
list.item: is an Inſtrument to pull up Hairs with by the Root, Tweezers: Or a Chyrurgions little Tongs, which are of different ſhape according to the Diverſity of their Uſe.
list.label: Volvulus,
list.item: ſee Ileon and Chordapſus.
list.label: Vomica,
list.item: is a fault in the Lungs, from Heterogeneous Blood, which being lodged perhaps in one of the little Bladdery Cells there, occaſions neither a Fever nor a Cough; but afterward when it is encreaſed, it oppreſſes the neighbouring Sanguiferous Veſſels, and impregnates the Blood as it paſſes along with its Effluviums; whereupon there ſucceeds a ſmall Fever, accompanied with Inquietude and Leanneſs; at laſt when it is full grown and concocted into Matter, it makes a Neſt as it were and lodges there.
list.label: Vomitorium,
list.item: is a Medicine taken inwardly, made of Emeticks, or things that provoke Vomiting, infuſed, diſſolved, or decocted.
list.label: Vomitus, a Vomiting,
list.item: is a violent and inverſe Motion of the Ventricle, wherein its fleſhy Fibres being irritated, and contracted towards the left Orifice, ſend out at the Mouth whatſoever is contained in the Stomach.
list.label: Ʋrachus
list.item: is the urinary Paſſage in Faetus's, reaching from the Bladder to the Membrane called Allanitodes; which after the Faetus is born becomes like a Ligament, and is that which ſuſpends the Bladder; it is joyned with the Navel and the bottom of the Bladder.
list.label: Ʋraniſmus,
list.item: the ſame that Palatum.
list.label: Ʋrentia,
list.item: ſee Pyrotica.
list.label: Ʋreter,
list.item: is a fiſtulous membranaceous Veſſel, which proceeds from both Reins, and opens between the Membranes of the Bladder, by which the Urine paſſes from the Reins to the Bladder: Celſus calls it the White Vein.
list.label: Ʋrethra, or Fiſtula,
list.item: is the urinary Paſſage, whereby the Urine is diſcharged at the Yard in Man, and in like manner in Women: It ſerves alſo for the Ejection of Seed. The ſeminal little Bladders, empty themſelves into it by two Holes at the beginning of it, when there is occaſion; which Bladders or Veſſels are ſurrounded with glandulous Proſtates, perforated with ſeveral Holes; to which there is a little peice of Fleſh affixed.
list.label: Ʋrinaria Fiſtula,
list.item: the ſame that Ʋrethra.
list.label: Ʋretica,
list.item: the ſame that Diuretica.
list.label: Ʋrina,
list.item: ſee Ʋron.
list.label: Ʋrocriſis,
list.item: the ſame that Ʋrocritica.
list.label: Ʋrocriterium,
list.item: is a Judgment upon Urine.
list.label: Ʋrocritica,
list.item: are Signs which are obſerved from Urines.
list.label: Ʋromantia,
list.item: ſee Ʋrocriterium.
list.label: Ʋromantis,
list.item: is one who can divine ſomething from Urines.
list.label: Ʋron, Ʋrina, Lotium,
list.item: is a ſerous Excrement conveyed from the Blood, that paſſes the Reins by the Ureters to the Bladder, and ſo is excerned when occaſion requires: It conſiſts of much Salt, a little Sulphur, of Earth and Spirit.
list.label: Ʋroſcopia,
list.item: is the Inſpection of Urine.
list.label: Ʋteri oſculum,
list.item: ſee Oſculum uteri.
list.label: Ʋteri Procidentia,
list.item: ſee Procidentia uteri.
list.label: Ʋſnea,
list.item: is Moſs which grows upon Bones or Trees.
list.label: Ʋterus, the Womb,
list.item: is an organical part placed in a Woman's Abdomen, which is divided into the Bottom, the Neck, and the Sheath: It has two broad Ligaments, and two round: It is of a nervous and fibrous Subſtance; and is of different Thickneſs according to the difference of Age, and time of going with Child. At the bottom within, there is a Cavity whence the Courſes flow, wherein likewiſe Generation and Conception are made: Before it is the Bladder; behind it is the Gut Rectum.
list.label: Vulneraria,
list.item: ſee Traumatica.
list.label: Vulnas a Wound,
list.item: is a Solution of the Continuumu with ſome external Inſtrument. It is different, as well according to the place or part whence it is inflicted, as upon a Nerve, or the Fleſh, as according to the Inſtrument which inflicts it; ſo that if it be done by a ſharp keen Inſtrument, it is called Sectio & Inciſio, cutting or Inciſion; if by pricking, 'tis called Punctura or Punctio.
list.label: Vulſella,
list.item: ſee Volſella.
list.label: Vulva,
list.item: is a Woman's ſecret Parts: See Gunnus.
list.label: Ʋvula,
list.item: ſee Cion.
list.label: Ʋvea Membrana, or Choroides,
list.item: is almoſt alltogether Continuous on the inſide to the Tunica Scelerotis; it is perforated in the fore part, and leaves a ſpace for the Apple of the Eye, which may be contracted or dilated.

list.head: X.
list.label: XErophthalmia,
list.item: is a dry Bleardneſs or Bloodſhot of the Eyes.
list.label: Xerotes,
list.item: is a dry Diſpoſition of Body.
list.label: Xiphoides,
list.item: is the pointed Cartilage of the Breaſt.
list.label: Xyſter,
list.item: is an Inſtrument to ſhave and ſcrape Bones with.

list.head: Z.
list.label: ZErna,
list.item: the ſame that Lichen.
list.label: Zirbus with the Arabians,
list.item: is the ſame that Omentum the Cawl.
list.label: Zone,
list.item: is that part of the Body where we are begirt; alſo a ſort of Herpes called Holy-fire.
list.label: Zoogonia,
list.item: is a Generation of perfect Animals born alive.
list.label: Zootomia,
list.item: is an artificial Diſſection of Animals.
list.label: Zotica,
list.item: is the vital Faculty.
list.label: Zygoma,
list.item: is the jugal Bone about the Temples.
list.label: Zymoma,
list.item: is a Ferment, as the nitrous Air, the Watery Juice in the Mouth, the acide Liquor in the Stomach, the Blood in the Spleen, &c.
list.label: Zymoſis,
list.item: ſee Fermentatio.

div.head: Theſe Books ſold by John Gellibrand, at the Golden Ball in St. Paul's Church-Yard.
div.p: Theoph. Bonnetti Anatomia Practica, Fol. 2 vol.
Baudrandi Geographia, ordine Litterarum diſpoſita, Fol. 2 vol.
Zodiacus Medico-Gallicus, in tribus Tomis, in Quarto.
The Morals of Plutarch tranſlated from the Greek Original, by ſeveral Hands in Octavo, now in the Preſs.
Publ. Virgilii Maronis Opera, cum Notis Selectiſſimis Johannis Minellii, in Twelves.
